name: Manganelli Palace Hotel

reviews.text: The location was great, being in between the bus station and main piazza. The room was clean, had plenty of room and a small balcony; however, there was no fresco of any kind, just white paint (room right off of the breakfast room). The staff was very friendly and most spoke good English. All of the recommendations they gave me were helpful. I really liked two restaurants near the piazza for Italian seafood dishes: Sicilia in Bocca and Osteria Antica Sicilia. I did a day-trip via bus to Taormina and recommend it. The ruins there are really well-preserved and there are lots of shops, cafes and restaurants to enjoy. You catch the blue buses in a lot two blocks from the main bus station. The tickets are bought at an office one block from the lot. I also did the afternoon trip to Mount Etna. I wanted the morning trip, but the company moved me due to another couple wanting the cave tour, which was nothing special. Francesca was a good tour guide who provided useful information. If you are into markets, make sure to check out the fish market by the duomo and the flea market not too far from Manganelli Palace which has a variety of things.
reviews.title: Great location with helpful staff

reviews.text: Manganelli Palace is perfectly situated close to the city centre of Catania. It's a "Palazzo" of the XVIIIth century which has kept beautifully painted ceilings in each bedroom. The welcome was warm and the staff particularly helpful.
reviews.title: A cosy hotel well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Manganelli Palace is located in Catania centre, close to Piazza del Duomo and the busy shopping street Via Etnea. It is lively busy on Saturday outside and until late night quite noisy, which can be heard inside, despite the curtains and windows. Easiliy reachable with bus 457 from the airport. Buy the busticket (€ 1.50 vs a taxi € 20) inside the airport (the outside ticketcentre is not always occupied). If it is late take a taxi. Get off at Piazza del Duomo, walk straight across the Duomo square / piazza del Duomo past the church and get on the shopping street Via Etnea. Then take the 3rd street to the right or ask the many police officers the Piazza Manganelli.The hotel is somehow odd, an elevator to the reception on the 3rd floor and the rooms through another elevator (2 buildings, which are glued together). The air conditioning and safe did not work properly, the shower is great, but water leaks under the glass (room 303), giving you wet feet on a necessary towel on the floor. Simple breakfast in a small space, but the price is fine. Watch out for the quiet spots around the quiet neighbourhood of the market. We were almost robbed by a thief on a scooter (also happens in NL). Take a tour to Mount Etna (half a day € 49, pricey but the enthusiastic tour leader Francesca offers you a good and enthousiastic story). 3 days Catania, but 2.5 days would have been sufficient. Manganelli palace is a good start for visiting Catania and Etna.
reviews.title: Manganelli 'palace', near Piazza del Duomo and Via Etnea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the being of our trip and one at the end, our rooom was ok with a sort of wet room shower which water was cold in shower and I slipped up in it as it did not flow away correctly bed was king size and rock hard the last night we were put in a single room with a small double bed with an oldish shower room the toilet paper is the thinest ever! Glad I brought a roll! Our room very chain like, breakfast ok , Staff however are excellent and helpful especially the lady running the very small breakfast room good central location very quaint old lift only takes two thin people wih small bags! stairs quite a climb so wait for lift! Although at the top of a Palace with some palace like suiets other guests mention rooms like ours its
reviews.title: Center of Catania room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok for short city break . Pack some of your favorite loo paper!
reviews.title: Sight for sore eyes ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good choice of hotel for visiting Catania for all the reasons I can think of. The price was reasonable, the location excellent, the room large and very quiet, everything worked. But most of all the staff were charming, smiley and very helpful (all of them).
reviews.title: Good choice for every reason

reviews.text: Really good location in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Great location and very confortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing building well refurbished and decorated with taste. High celling roof well painted. Large beds and confortable furniture.
reviews.title: Very nice located hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff was really friendly.
reviews.title: Unique Boutique Hotel in City Center

reviews.text: A very good choice in the city centre, walking distance to most of the attractions in this wonderful town. We travelled as a young couple and the room we had was a double bed room with a beautiful ceiling and a nice tiny terrace. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The staff at the hotel was not friendly at all but polite. We've seen the suite which is a very good choice if you're looking for something extra, with a beautiful painted ceiling and very well preserved!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Manganelli Palace located on a narrow street amid uncollected piles of garbage (probably a refuse collection strike). After the chaotic and stressful drive into the city during the evening rush hour, walking up the four flights of stairs to the reception on the top floor because someone had not closed the door of the lift provided light relief that things could not get worse. The check in was quick and painless though.
reviews.title: Centrally located

reviews.text: Parking is not provided by the hotel and I was directed to a public car park which cost €10.00 to €13.00 for overnight parking.
reviews.title: Well worth a stay

reviews.text: The room we were allocated was spacious with high ceilings and gave the room an airy feel. Sleep quality was good on the firm but comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and Great Location!

reviews.text: The hotel is not far from the city centre and is convenient for the Doumo and the restaurants around the area. It is a pleasant place to stay in with good access to Mount Etna.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Not the whole palace, indeed, but one floor of it. Ring the bell, get into an old old elevator, with space barely enough for two, and here you are, in the hotel, a very small one, occupying just a floor of the beautiful palazzo. It actually seems very modern, until you enter the room, and there you go, fantastic ceilings with frescoes, I assume quite a few centuries old. The ceiling in the bathroom is of usual height, btw, so, basically, when looking from your bed, you see the "fake" ceiling of the bathroom, and well above it extends the continuation of the original one. Well, remodeling, fare enough I should say, humidity won't do much good to those frescoes. Rooms are very nice, and the bed is comfy. You also have safe, and all the usual amenities. Staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is very good to my tastes, with nice espresso, fresh pastry, and some limited, but decent choice of ham and cheese. The water pressure is a bit of a nuisance, at least in my room, a friend of mine, staying in the other room had no complaints. Basically, a very decent stay, pity for the modern feel and the utter feeling of remodeling present everywhere in the common areas. And yes, location is very good, try the local bar Razmataz just few minites walking from there, not a touristy place, and with a very good wine selection, which is what we look for, don't we?
reviews.title: Great location but too noisy

reviews.text: We stayed at the suite and it was beautiful and very accomdathing the stuff was very nice but not helpful at all. The parking was not close unless you use the public one at the piazza manganelli just out side the hotel (make sure you find a parking by yourself don't use the help of the locals 'working' there)
reviews.title: The suite worth the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A must place to stay.Staff so friendly and accomodating to your every need. Room was large with fresco on the ceiling.Every attraction within walking distance. Every Aussie going to Catania this is the place to stay
reviews.title: 3 days in Catania

reviews.text: A wonderful hotel in the very centre of Catania!! The courtesy and kindness of the staff was fantastic and if you are lucky enough (as we were) to be upgraded in the suite you are going to enjoy a superb room with frescos and a spectacular view over Catania's roofs and domes... We loved it!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!
Charming hotel in an old palace
reviews.text: A very good choice in the city centre of Catania, with walking distance to most of the attractions in town. The room we had was a three bed room with a beautiful stucco ceiling and a nice terrace , the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We got great help from the staff at the hotel. We got to see the suite which is a very good choice if you're looking for something extra, very well preserved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: perfect location, clean and kind staff. i would come back with no worries.
reviews.title: Catania at its best

description: In a prestigious position of the baroque of Catania rises the Manganelli building, an ancient noble residence. The Manganelli Palace borns indoors it, pleasant and exclusive hotel in which refinement and style mingle to draw an elegant and unique environment which represents the new way of sleeping in Catania. Thanks to the strategic position from where you can admire the town, to the wise restoration of the frescoes and to the maximum attention in the details, the classical style is combined with the elegance of the contemporary style offering an exclusive receptivity. Both who travels for pleasure or for business will be surround oneself with rooms elegantly furnished, comfortable and with every comfort.
